intro: Abutilon muticum var. villosum, commonly known as the silky abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, lantern-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and adaptability contribute to its appeal in both tropical and temperate climates.
distribution_native_art_desc: Abutilon muticum var. villosum is primarily native to coastal regions of southern California and northern Baja California, Mexico. distribution_introduced_art_desc: Abutilon muticum var. villosum was mainly introduced to New Zealand. It was brought there as an ornamental plant due to its attractive fuzzy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant has since become naturalized in certain regions, particularly in the North Island.
